concise_definition: v. 拿, 采取, 需要, 接受, 乘坐

definitions.explanation_en: To carry or move something from one place to another, often with the hands; to grasp or hold something physically.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指用手从一处移动或携带某物到另一处；物理上抓住或握住某物。
definitions.example_en: She takes her coffee black, without sugar or cream.
definitions.example_cn: 她喝咖啡不加糖也不加奶。

definitions.explanation_en: To require or demand a certain amount of time, effort, or resources to accomplish something.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指完成某事所需花费一定的时间、精力或资源。
definitions.example_en: It takes courage to speak up in front of a large audience.
definitions.example_cn: 在大量观众面前发言需要勇气。

definitions.explanation_en: To accept or receive something offered, often reluctantly or as a necessity.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指接受或接纳他人提供的事物，常带有勉强或无奈的意味。
definitions.example_en: He takes criticism well, even when it's harsh.
definitions.example_cn: 即使批评很严厉，他也能坦然接受。

definitions.explanation_en: To use or board a form of transportation, such as a bus, train, or plane.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指乘坐某种交通工具，如公共汽车、火车或飞机。
definitions.example_en: I take the subway to work every morning.
definitions.example_cn: 我每天早上坐地铁上班。

definitions.explanation_en: To adopt or follow a particular course of action, attitude, or position.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指采取某种行动方式、态度或立场。
definitions.example_en: The company takes a firm stance on environmental sustainability.
definitions.example_cn: 该公司在环境可持续性问题上持坚定立场。

comparison.analysis: “Gets” (得到) 更强调结果或被动获得，常用于非主动的获取，如“get a gift”（收到礼物）。“Takes” 则强调主动的、有意识的获取或采取，如“take a book”（拿一本书），带有控制或意图的意味。
“Brings” (带来) 指将某物从别处带到说话者所在的位置，强调方向性（从外到内）。“Takes” 则相反，指将某物从当前位置带到别处（从内到外）。例如：“She brings her laptop to meetings”（她把笔记本带到会议） vs. “She takes her laptop home”（她把笔记本带回家）。
“Requires” (需要) 是正式用语，强调客观必要性，常用于规则、系统或条件的语境，如“This job requires experience”。“Takes” 更口语化，常用于描述完成某事所需的主观投入，如“It takes patience”，语气更贴近日常经验，而非制度性要求。
